# iosxr_linux_networking (Resource)

This resource can manage the Linux Networking configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxr_linux_networking" "example" {
  statistics_synchronization_sixty_seconds = true
  exposed_interfaces = [
    {
      interface_name                           = "GigabitEthernet0/0/0/0"
      linux_managed                            = "disable"
      statistics_synchronization_sixty_seconds = true
    }
  ]
  vrfs = [
    {
      vrf_name                            = "default"
      ipv4_source_interface_default_route = "GigabitEthernet0/0/0/0"
      ipv6_source_interface_default_route = "GigabitEthernet0/0/0/0"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `exposed_interfaces` (Attributes List) Specify an IOS-XR interface to expose to Linux (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--exposed_interfaces))
- `linux_owned_vrf` (String) Configure a VRF as Linux-owned, to be mapped to the default Linux network namespace
- `statistics_synchronization_eight_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 8 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_five_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 5 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_four_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 4 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_nine_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 9 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_seven_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 7 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_six_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 6 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_sixty_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every sixty seconds
- `statistics_synchronization_ten_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 10 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_thirty_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every thirty seconds
- `statistics_synchronization_three_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 3 minutes
- `statistics_synchronization_two_minutes` (Boolean) Sync every 2 minutes
- `vrfs` (Attributes List) Configuration for a particular VRF (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--vrfs))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--exposed_interfaces"></a>
### Nested Schema for `exposed_interfaces`

Required:

- `interface_name` (String) Specify an IOS-XR interface to expose to Linux
- `linux_managed` (String) Properties of this interface are controlled by linux, not IOS-XR
  - Choices: `disable`, `enable`

Optional:

- `statistics_synchronization_five_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every five seconds
- `statistics_synchronization_sixty_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every sixty seconds
- `statistics_synchronization_ten_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every ten seconds
- `statistics_synchronization_thirty_seconds` (Boolean) Sync every thirty seconds


<a id="nestedatt--vrfs"></a>
### Nested Schema for `vrfs`

Required:

- `vrf_name` (String) Configuration for a particular VRF

Optional:

- `disable` (Boolean) Disable synchronization of this VRF with Linux. Linux applications will not be able to communicate over interfaces in the VRF
- `east_west_interfaces` (Attributes List) Configure an East West Interface for a VRF. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--vrfs--east_west_interfaces))
- `ipv4_default_route_software_forwarding` (Boolean) Use software forwarding instead of hardware forwarding. This may be required to send Linux traffic via the default route over management ports
- `ipv4_source_default_route_active_management` (Boolean) Use active RP management interface for source hint
- `ipv4_source_interface_default_route` (String) Interface name for source hint
- `ipv4_source_interface_management_route` (String) Interface name for source hint
- `ipv6_default_route_software_forwarding` (Boolean) Use software forwarding instead of hardware forwarding. This may be required to send Linux traffic via the default route over management ports
- `ipv6_source_default_route_active_management` (Boolean) Use active RP management interface for source hint
- `ipv6_source_interface_default_route` (String) Interface name for source hint
- `ipv6_source_interface_management_route` (String) Interface name for source hint

<a id="nestedatt--vrfs--east_west_interfaces"></a>
### Nested Schema for `vrfs.east_west_interfaces`

Required:

- `interface_name` (String) Configure an East West Interface for a VRF.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxr_linux_networking.example ""
```
